SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractMonsterController
A controller which generates a monster move at regular intervals.
Animator
The primary responsibility of this class is to trigger the board viewer to display the next animation.
Board
Maintain a rectangular board of cells, potentially occupied by guests.
BoardViewer
A simple way to paint a pacman board.
Cell
A Cell keeps track of its (x,y) position on the board, and the potential Guest occupying the Cell.
Engine
The top level state machine, which also acts as interface to the viewer (which observes the state machine) and the controller (which triggers the state machine events).
Food
Food having a number of calories, which can occupy a cell on the board.
Game
Representation of the board and its guests.
Guest
Class containing responsibilities shared by all Guests.
ImageFactory
The responsibilities of this class include obtaining images from file, that can be used for animations of the player and the monsters in Pacman.
IMonsterController
Interface for a controller which generates a monster move at regular intervals.
Monster
A monster on the board.
Move
A potential move from one cell to another.
MovingGuest
Type for guests with moving capabilities.
Pacman
Top level Pacman class.
PacmanUI
Construct the top level GUI.
Player
The player which can walk around on the board, eat food, and die when meeting a monster.
PlayerMove
Class to represent the effects of moving the player.
RandomMonsterMover
Example, simple monster mover that just moves monsters randomly.
Wall
A wall positioned on a cell on the board.
